p: Not all oxylipins have a detrimental effect on the heart. CYP enzymes are highly expressed in the heart, and they are involved in converting AA to eicosanoids, which have a cardio-protective role [ 83, 84, 85]. Some of them, such as epoxy-eicosatrienoic acid (EpETrE), attenuate ischemia/reperfusion injury [ 84]. Moreover, EpETrE improved the electrical activity of the heart following ischemia/reperfusion injury [ 86, 87]. This protective role is induced through multiple pathways involving mitochondrial and sarcolemmal potassium channels, p42/p44 MAPK (mitogen-activated protein kinase), and PI3K-AKT [ 88].
